public class zeta.format.impl.FormatAppend

(source file: impl/FormatAppend.java)

                           +----zeta.format.impl.FormatAppend
The pure class interface. 
public class FormatAppend
  extends CompoundFormat
This is a compound Format class for a list of Formats that should be printed 'beside' each other like it is done for FormatBeside. This means, that each text is printed beside the end of the last line of the text before it. However, unlike for FormatBeside, which prints the Formats beneath each other, if the text would otherwise become too wide, FormatAppend prints its components 'beside' each other in every case, so it should be used very carefully.

The append-behaviour is especially useful for interpunctions that should normally not be printed on the beginning of a new line. Instead the break should be made before the block preceding the item to be appended.

Author:
Jacob Wieland (ughosage@cs.tu-berlin.de)
See also:
FormatBeside
